alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Outflow winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northeastern Grant and western Hooker Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 832 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 26 miles northeast of Ashby to near Whitman to 6 miles east of Hyannis. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Whitman, Carr Lake, Duluth, Hire, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Pratt Lake, Sevenmile Hill and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 148 and 174. Highway 61 between mile markers 149 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
